guidanceText: The federal government introduced its new Temporary Wage Subsidy (TWS) for eligible employers from March 18, 2020 to June 19, 2020.
The Canada Emergency Wage Subsidy would cover 75 per cent of salaries for qualifying businesses, for up to 3 months, retroactive to March 15, 2020.

guidanceTitle: Extended income tax filing and payment dates​
guidanceText: Allow more time to file  income taxes and deferred payment dates

guidanceTitle: Deferral of Sales Tax Remittance and Customs Duty Payments​
guidanceText: A new  federal program will be rolled out in mid-April that helps to cover operating costs for businesses experiencing temporary revenue reductions.
A new  federal program will be rolled out in mid-April that helps to cover operating costs for businesses experiencing temporary revenue reductions.

guidanceTitle: Extended duration of the work-sharing program​
guidanceText: Special mesuares to support employers and workers in the work-sharing program

guidanceTitle: Ground lease rents suspended for air transportation sector
guidanceText: Support for airport authorities to waive ground lease rents from March 2020 through to December 2020

guidanceTitle: Part I license fees waived for broadcasters
guidanceText: Support for broadcasters to waive Part I license fees for the 2020-2021 fiscal year
